Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery stemless cup; lip differentially offset inside and out; interior: glazed black; exterior: glazed save for narrow reserved band at offset of lip, above the red-figure scene: beardless warrior to left (upper part remaining) wearing Corinthian helmet pushed back and baldric; in back view, with shield on left arm, spear raised high in right hand); his advanced foot and end of the spear are preserved on the non-joining 1900,0217.9.
Curator's comments: The sherd is joined by plaster with British Museum 1900,0214.9, giving the full profile of the cup (a red-figured Castulo cup). Note in interleaved BM Cat.Vases III (E134.5): the low foot of the kylix with part of the palmette and lower part of another warrior was found in 1900 and joined. Beazley (CVA Oxford, 13 on pl. 14, 24) suggests that this sherd belongs with Oxford G138.24.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E134.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0728) (Phase 1)
